title: Apple Stock Could Reach $2 Trillion Market Cap In 4 Years
summary:
Now one Wall Street analyst sees the consumer electronics giant reaching a $2 trillion market cap in the next four years.
XIn a note to clients Monday, Evercore ISI analyst Amit Daryanani outlined the path to a $2 trillion market value for Apple stock.
He reiterated his outperform rating on Apple stock and raised his price target to 360 from 345.
On the stock market today, Apple stock rose 1.2% to 321.85.
Key Levers To Reaching $2 Trillion ValueApple would hit a market value of $2 trillion if Apple stock gets to 550, Daryanani said.
text:
Apple (AAPL) was the first company to reach a market capitalization of $1 trillion back in August 2018. Now one Wall Street analyst sees the consumer electronics giant reaching a $2 trillion market cap in the next four years. Apple stock rose on Monday.

X

In a note to clients Monday, Evercore ISI analyst Amit Daryanani outlined the path to a $2 trillion market value for Apple stock.

He reiterated his outperform rating on Apple stock and raised his price target to 360 from 345.

On the stock market today, Apple stock rose 1.2% to 321.85. Its current market cap is nearly $1.4 trillion.

Key Levers To Reaching $2 Trillion Value

Apple would hit a market value of $2 trillion if Apple stock gets to 550, Daryanani said. That implies mid-teens stock appreciation annually.

Apple's key levers to get to a $2 trillion market cap are earnings-per-share growth, improving gross margins, services and wearables growth, and multiple expansion, he said.

Daryanani thinks Apple can get to $23 in earnings per share in fiscal 2024, vs. $12 in fiscal 2019.

"This implies EPS growth of 14% over next several years driven by combination of operational tailwinds and buyback support," he said.

The company's growing services business should drive Apple's gross profit margins higher, he said. Apple's services segment operates with gross margins in the mid-60% range. That compares with a corporate average in the high 30% range, Daryanani said.

In addition to services, Apple is seeing strong growth in wearables such as the Apple Watch and AirPods wireless earbuds.

Apple Stock On Leaderboard Watchlist

"Apple continues to offer the best risk/reward in large-cap tech and long-term investors should use any weakness to add to positions," Daryanani said.

On April 29, Apple stock broke out of a second-stage cup-with-handle base with a buy point of 288.35, according to IBD MarketSmith charts. It is now extended from that buy point.

In recent days, the Dow Jones tech giant has been flirting with a new buy point of 319.79. That's from a cup-with-handle base visible on a weekly MarketSmith chart. The new buy point is an alternative entry, according to IBD Leaderboard analysis. A breakout here would give investors the opportunity to add to an existing position.

Apple stock is on IBD's prestigious Leaderboard stock watchlist.

Follow Patrick Seitz on Twitter at @IBD_PSeitz for more stories on consumer technology, software and semiconductor stocks.

<div class="featured-post-image-container"></div>
<div class="addtoany_share_save_container addtoany_content_top row">

<ul class="post-meta">

<div class="single-post-content post-content drop-cap">
<p><strong>Apple</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=AAPL' target='_blank'>AAPL</a>) was the first company to reach a market capitalization of $1 trillion back in August 2018. Now one Wall Street analyst sees the consumer electronics giant reaching a $2 trillion market cap in the next four years. Apple stock rose on Monday.</p>
<span>
<span style="width:50%;" class="video-player-container vms-left">
<span class="shortcode-video" vid-id="5884087" vid-dom-id="5884087-5ed709c02e18f" vid-top="false" vid-repeat="1" vid-width="50" vid-url="https://content.jwplatform.com/manifests/KzfUaBe3.m3u8" data-captions="[{"name":"English","url":"https:\/\/content.jwplatform.com\/tracks\/GtnWFfIS"}]" vid-name="Stocks Shrug Off Headlines; Tesla, Apple Break Out, Zoom Video Soars" vid-cat="Stock Market Today" vid-date="06/01/2020" vid-image="https://www.investors.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/KzfUaBe3-640x360.jpg" vid-authors="ALISSA CORAM, Ed Carson">
<span class="close-mini-vid">X</span>
<span id="shortcode-video-player-5884087-5ed709c02e18f" class="ready-to-load"></span>
</span>
</span>
</span><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https:\/\/schema.org","@type":"VideoObject","name":"Stocks Shrug Off Headlines; Tesla, Apple Break Out, Zoom Video Soars","description":"Stocks shrug off headlines; Tesla, Apple break out, Zoom Video soars before earnings.","thumbnailUrl":"https:\/\/www.investors.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/06\/KzfUaBe3-640x360.jpg","contentUrl":"https:\/\/content.jwplatform.com\/manifests\/KzfUaBe3.m3u8","uploadDate":"2020-06-01T13:44:17+0000","duration":"PT489.00S","author":"ALISSA CORAM, Ed Carson","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Investor's Business Daily","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https:\/\/www.investors.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/06\/ibd-logo.png"},"url":"https:\/\/www.investors.com"},"keywords":""}</script>
<p>In a note to clients Monday, Evercore ISI analyst Amit Daryanani outlined the path to a $2 trillion market value for Apple stock.</p>
<p>He reiterated his outperform rating on Apple stock and raised his price target to 360 from 345.</p>
<p>On the <a href="https://www.investors.com/market-trend/stock-market-today/stock-market-today-market-trends-best-stocks-buy-watch/">stock market today</a>, Apple stock rose 1.2% to 321.85. Its current market cap is nearly $1.4 trillion.</p>

<h2>Key Levers To Reaching $2 Trillion Value</h2>
<p>Apple would hit a market value of $2 trillion if Apple stock gets to 550, Daryanani said. That implies mid-teens stock appreciation annually.</p>
<p>Apple's key levers to get to a $2 trillion market cap are earnings-per-share growth, improving gross margins, services and wearables growth, and multiple expansion, he said.</p>
<p>Daryanani thinks Apple can get to $23 in earnings per share in fiscal 2024, vs. $12 in fiscal 2019.</p>
<p>"This implies EPS growth of 14% over next several years driven by combination of operational tailwinds and buyback support," he said.</p>
<p>The company's growing services business should drive Apple's gross profit margins higher, he said. Apple's services segment operates with gross margins in the mid-60% range. That compares with a corporate average in the high 30% range, Daryanani said.</p>
<p>In addition to services, Apple is seeing strong growth in wearables such as the Apple Watch and AirPods wireless earbuds.</p>
<h2>Apple Stock On Leaderboard Watchlist</h2>
<p>"Apple continues to offer the best risk/reward in large-cap tech and long-term investors should use any weakness to add to positions," Daryanani said.</p>
<p>On April 29, Apple stock broke out of a second-stage <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/the-basics-how-to-analyze-a-stocks-cup-with-handle/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">cup-with-handle base</a> with a <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/chart-reading-basics-how-a-buy-point-marks-a-time-of-opportunity/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">buy point</a> of 288.35, according to <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/marketsmith/?artProdLink=MarketSmith" target="_blank" rel="noopener">IBD MarketSmith charts</a>. It is now <a href="https://education.investors.com/financial-dictionary/general/extended--op-in-price-cp-">extended</a> from that buy point.</p>
<p>In recent days, the Dow Jones tech giant has been flirting with a new buy point of 319.79. That's from a cup-with-handle base visible on a weekly MarketSmith chart. The new buy point is an alternative entry, according to <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/leaderboard/?artProdLink=Leaderboard">IBD Leaderboard analysis</a>. A breakout here would give investors the opportunity to add to an existing position.</p>
<p>Apple stock is on IBD's prestigious Leaderboard stock watchlist.</p>
